Solid understanding of Git and version control  ? DevOps experience with CICD. Experience with GitHub Actions/Jenkins a plus  ? 2+ yrs of working with a cloud provider (Azure/AWS/GCP)  ? Solid Experience with Containerization and Orchestration (OSS2, Docker, Kubernetes)  ? Experience with one or more of INFA EDC, AXON, Dremio, BigID is a plus.   Additional Information:  NYC Candidates preferred - looking for 1-2 days per week in the office.  Will consider remote but only for perfect candidate.

Summary of Position  Work effectively with leaders of Pharmacy and other Departments to learn and understand stated goals, develop reports and provide analytics support to accomplish them. Interpret and utilize data and information to develop and provide recommendations for process improvements. Establish strong relationships within the company to leverage necessary subject matter expertise to reach solutions. Strive for innovative data analytics solutions; work with PBM to ensure accurate and effective reporting support.  Principal Accountabilities  Generate complex data analytics projects using both Pharmacy and Medical data.  o Meet with internal and external business partners to determine the objectives and specifics of each project and create project plans.  o Create SAS code for each project to ensure efficient and repeatable reporting.  o Set milestones to ensure the projects are on track.  o Review each SAS log to ensure accuracy and document results, then obtain sign-off from immediate supervisor.  o Communicate clearly the details of the projects to the supervisor and the leadership.  o Maintain project dashboard and provide weekly updates to immediate supervisor.  Complete the data analytics projects efficiently. Determine if a request will be a one-time or a recurring project. If it is a recurring project, create a process to easily replicate. Pursue innovative data analytics solutions, using advanced tools and predictive analytics. Follow the changes in the Health Care Industry closely and contribute to EmblemHealth turnaround. Collaborate on complex special projects to support department with flexibility, for example Formulary Cost Analysis and Medical Utilization Management cost analysis. Utilization Management (UM) Reporting  o Maintain a process of daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting.  o Interact with UM vendor for streamlined reporting solutions.  o Collaborate with CMS auditors on Program Audits, Timeliness Monitoring and various other types of audits.  o Create reports for NCQA accreditation project. Report the results to Pharmacy leadership to monitor timeliness of coverage determination reviews.  Handle the Annual Health Plan Management System (HPMS) Data Submission.  o Develop quarterly review process.  o Establish strong QA process for accurate reporting.  Assist management on special projects. Support New Plan Year implementation testing. Support CMS audits. Support financial statement audits. Provide support to cascaded projects and goals. Regulatory Reporting:  o Medicaid Managed Care Operating Report  o Special Investigation Unit reports  o Retiree Drug Subsidy Reports for USA, NYSHIP, MTA  Other reports:  o OMT  o Upload and analyze cash receipt rebate files from ESI  o STARS and PPA reports  o ALPHA GH3, NonGH3, CCI Medicare, CCI HIX/Commercial table creation and maintenance  o Inpharmative data analysis and manipulation until vendor is sunset  Various Ad Hoc Reports Other activities, including creating guides and training new team members.  Education, Training, Licenses, Certifications  Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Health Administration, Math, Sciences, IT or related; Master’s preferred.  Relevant Work Experience, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Minimum of four (4) to six (6) years’ experience in data analytics. (R) Related experience in a PBM or Managed Healthcare setting. (P) Strong expertise with MS Office tools (including Access and Excel). (R) Programming experience or working knowledge of SAS or Oracle/SQL queries. (R) Effective communication (verbal, written, presentation) skills. (R) Experience working with Medicare Part D. (P) Reporting/Business Intelligence experience. (R) Understanding of financial concepts, claims processing concepts and knowledge of healthcare operating systems. (R)

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Global Data Science & Analytics
job_Description: Zeta Global is looking for a talented Senior Data Analyst / Predictive Modeler to join our Analytics team. Armed with advanced analytics skills, this position will be responsible for supporting and improving the quality of our campaign optimization efforts via data analysis, predictive modeling and reporting. This position will report to the Sr. Manager / Director of Analytics.   Responsibilities: - Generate data-driven analyses & insights that lead to improved ROI for our advertisers - Support the development of state-of-the-art predictive and machine learning models to improve campaign performance - Work with cross-functional teams to understand advertiser needs, and provide custom reporting & visualization solutions. - Support the management of internal data marts and modeling infrastructure - Monitor the quality & integrity of data sources   Requirements: - You love being a change agent! You tangibly add value for decision makers with actionable insights from data - Proven ability to implement statistical analysis and / or predictive modeling techniques - Ability to disseminate insights using data visualization tools - Exceptional attention-to-detail with the ability to meet aggressive deadlines. We move at a fast pace and generally have 3-5 projects going at any one time - Excellent communication and presentation skills. The findings from data mining and analyses are no good if you can't present it in an effective and organized fashion   Desired Background: - BS Eng / Operations Research / Industrial Engineering / Statistics / Mathematics / Physics or similar quantitative disciplines with 3+ years of experience. MS degree holders in these disciplines with 1+ years of experience will also be considered - Live work experience with data analysis tools like SAS, SPSS, R, MATLAB, MATHEMATICA, Python - Work experience in Healthcare / Engineering / Advertising / Financial Services / Consulting is attractive   Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Zeta  We are committed to building diverse teams with different identities, backgrounds and perspectives.  We believe in providing a forum to connect at Zeta, to learn and celebrate differences. Our mission is to ensure we have an environment that enables a deep level of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work, and to increase both diversity at Zeta as well as in the technology industry.  Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual ' s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation or gender identity or expression.   Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.   About Zeta Global Zeta Global is a data-powered marketing technology company with a heritage of innovation and industry leadership. Founded in 2007 by entrepreneur David A. Steinberg and John Sculley, former CEO of Apple Inc and Pepsi-Cola, the Company combines the industry's 3rd largest proprietary data set (2.4B+ identities) with Artificial Intelligence to unlock consumer intent, personalize experiences and help our clients drive business growth. Our technology runs on the Zeta Marketing Platform, which powers 'end to end' marketing programs for some of the world's leading brands. With expertise encompassing all digital marketing channels – Email, Display, Social, Search and Mobile – Zeta orchestrates acquisition and engagement programs that deliver results that are scalable, repeatable and sustainable.   Zeta Global Recognized in Enterprise Marketing Software and Cross-Channel Campaign Management Reports by Independent Research Firm  https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/zeta-global-opens-ai-data-labs-in-san-francisco-and-nyc-300945353.html   https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/zeta-global-recognized-in-enterprise-marketing-software-and-cross-channel-campaign-management-reports-by-independent-research-firm-300938241.html   #LI-MC1  #LI-Remote

We are passionate about all things DevOps and Cloud Native and value teamwork, ownership, and customer success. Our employees are the most important part of Caylent and thrive in a fast-paced, distributed work environment that has been 100% remote since 2015. Our unique practice areas afford opportunities to work with the most modern, challenging, and exciting technologies that are leading edge. And most importantly, we have fun!  Caylent has been remote-first from the beginning. We use tools like Slack and other collaboration tools to ensure our team feels connected. Every Caylent team member has a pool of points to thank each other for going above and beyond. This has helped nurture our collaborative culture. One employee described asking for help feeling like simply walking to your neighbor's house and asking to borrow a cup of sugar. We believe strongly in supporting one another and going the extra mile for our customers and for each other. About the Job  At Caylent, a Senior Cloud Machine Learning Architect works as an integral part of a cross-functional delivery team to design and document machine learning solutions on the AWS cloud for our customers. We are looking for someone that has a strong understanding of the various model types and tools, and can help our customers connect their business goals with the details of feature design, model training and inference. You will decompose business goals into architectures that can meet those goals, and guide engineers in their hands-on implementation work.  You will participate in daily standup meetings with your team and bi-weekly agile ceremonies with the customer. Your manager will have a weekly 1:1 with you to help guide you in your career and make the most of your time at Caylent.  Responsibilities  Work with a team to deliver machine learning solutions on AWS for customers  Participate in daily standup meetings and in bi-weekly agile ceremonies  Design and document ML models and data flows on AWS  Preparation of training data for models  Requirements  Experience with an IaC tool such as CloudFormation, Amazon CDK or Terraform  Expert-level understanding of Amazon Sagemaker and ML libraries such as Tensorflow, MXNet, PyTorch or Scikit-learn  Strong Understanding of fundamental ML concepts such as feature definition, model meta-data, hyperparameter tuning, stochastic gradient descent, deep learning layer types and activation functions  Familiarity with MLOps tools such as MLflow, Neptune or Comet is a plus  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Benefits  100% remote work, either from home or in a shared workspace  401k with 4% company match  Medical, dental, vision and life insurance benefits with company paying up to 75% premiums  Generous holidays and unlimited flexible PTO  Paid for exams and certifications  Peer bonus awards  State of the art laptop and tools  Individual professional development plan  Work with an amazing worldwide team and in an incredible corporate culture   NOTE: We are unable to provide sponsorship for this position.  Caylent is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

Today, we're partnering with the world's leading companies to transform how they use data and technology. If these challenges excite you, we'd love to hear from you! About Clair  If you can send your friends money in seconds, why does it still take your employer two weeks to send your paycheck?  At Clair, we are on a mission to create financial freedom for America's workers by giving them an app that allows them to get paid as soon as they clock out of work. But we're not just another digital bank or on-demand pay provider. We meet Americans at their place of work by embedding our products within the scheduling, workforce management, and payroll apps they already use every day. And, as a social impact fintech, our promise to our users is simple: we'll never charge our users to access the money they've already worked for.  We welcome people who add a new set of experiences to our melting pot of backgrounds. We're 30-ish, spread across multiple states, hailing from various countries. We've got grandparents working alongside recent graduates, Americans partnering with immigrants, and self-taught coders debating with Ivy League graduates. We embrace diversity in all its forms.  We are backed by investors who are not only well-renowned in their fields, but are also great partners for us. We've raised $19.5 million from Thrive Capital, Upfront Ventures, Founder Collective, and Walkabout VC, as well as many individual investors like Michael Vaughan (Former COO of Venmo) and Paul Appelbaum (Founder of Seamless).  Learn more about us at getclair.com/about Are you who we're looking for?  We are looking for a top-tier analytics professional to deliver insights that drive growth at our next-generation digital bank. As a Data Analyst at Clair, you'll be joining a new and rapidly growing team of data practitioners who are passionate about bringing financial security to underserved communities.  As a trusted thought partner to product and business teams, you'll come to understand their goals and use your analytical power to surface impactful insights in support of these goals. Through experimentation, user funnel analysis, data modeling, and dashboard development, you will surface insights and recommendations that will enable Clair to reach hundreds of thousands of hourly workers and get them paid every day.  What will you do at Clair?   Help drive user growth using your data toolkit  Use data to generate insights, advocate for them and drive them into action  Partner with business stakeholders to answer questions and test hypotheses  Implement and manage metrics to drive product, operations, and growth decisions  Put data at the fingertips of stakeholders and empower them to self-serve  Maintain deliverables, projects, and timelines for your stakeholder engagements  Create efficient and scalable data pipelines; develop dashboards and visualizations  Collaborate to brainstorm ideas, verify analyses, and review your peers' work  Champion analytics engineering principles, including version control  Document metric definitions, processes, best practices and dashboard features   Qualifications   1-2 years of professional experience in the data analytics field  Consider yourself a "full stack" data analyst (experience across the end-to-end data value chain, including data collection, processing, querying, and visualization)  Fluent in SQL (translating business questions to queries, understanding joins and functions, and building data pipelines)  Experience using the command line and git  Solid understanding of data warehouses and business intelligence tools; experience with Tableau preferred  Experience with experimentation and statistical analysis to guide decision-making  Passionate about building the best version of whatever you're working on   Things we consider a plus:   Interest in financial systems and consumer behavior  Experience with Fintech products  Experience with Redshift (or AWS generally)  Experience with dbt  Experience with Tableau  Experience with a scripting language like Python or R   What to expect in the hiring process:   An introductory phone call with the Talent Team  A conversation with our Data Analytics Manager  A take-home technical assessment  A cross-functional panel interview and final round interview with a Clair executive  Need more convincing?  Apart from getting to work with our incredible team, here are some of the benefits you can expect when you join Clair:   100% Medical, Dental, & Vision Coverage, with option to extend to your family  Fully-paid parental leave  Company-sponsored 401k, HSA, and FSA  Telehealth & medical concierge services with OneMedical  Unlimited vacation  Work from home setup allowance  Citibike membership for NY-based employees  Access to your earnings every day on Clair  Company-sponsored short-term and long-term disability insurance  Equal Opportunity Employer Information  Clair is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We actively seek a diverse applicant pool and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.   For questions, please email us at careers@getclair.com

Want to help everyday Americans invest and build wealth? Financial inequality is increasing, and too many people are getting left behind. At Stash, we are passionate about democratizing wealth creation through education, advice, and products that help customers achieve greater financial freedom.  Stash is seeking Machine Learning Engineers to join our engineering team. This role focuses on shipping ML-driven features that enhance the steady building of wealth, spend management and financial education for millions of our customers.  As a ML engineer, you will work across many functions in the company from Design, Modeling, Engineering, Growth, Support and Fraud Prevention to enable sophisticated AI solutions at scale. We are looking for technical professionals with motivation and deep knowledge to build beautiful, intuitive products with empathy for our customers. This is a career-defining opportunity, where you will join one of the fast-growing fintech companies and help bring to market the latest innovations including crypto products.  You will:   Formulate a real-world enterprise scenario into a machine learning problem and design the optimal solutions for the problem.  Wrangle with large data sets on the cloud and transform them into innovative features/signals to improve a machine learning model.  Participate in end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, from prototyping, implementation & evaluation ML and DL models, followed by deployment and monitoring using cloud tools.  Develop entity graphs, feature stores, model training and model serving capabilities in a fault-tolerant distributed computing environment  Collaborate with other ML engineers and Data Scientists in building highly scalable ML models for NLP, Fraud Prevention, Growth, Recommenders, Personalization and other use cases  Understand industry and company-wide trends to help develop new technologies   Qualifications:   Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or related fields  2+ years of experience (or research projects in lieu of industry experience) in the areas of machine learning, data science, or information retrieval  Proficiency and demonstrable skills in programming languages (Python, C++, Java or related ML programming languages)  Experience with cloud computing platforms, such as AWS, Google Cloud or Azure  Eagerness to share your own ideas, and openness to those of others   #LI-JB1   At Stash it is our mission to help everyday Americans invest and build wealth. That includes people of all races, genders, and abilities, so it is important to us to acknowledge and address the issues of inequality in financial services head on.  Diversity and inclusion are essential to living our values, promoting innovation, and building the best products. Our success is directly related to our employees and we believe that our team should reflect the diversity of the customers that we serve. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Stash is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds.  If you require any reasonable accommodations to make your application process more accessible please reach out to recruiting@Stash.com. At Tilting Point, we combine data, technology, talent and groundbreaking marketing to scale games to success. As a senior/lead Data Analyst, you will not only work closely with different stakeholders like Growth team, Game team and Business Development team to help inform decision making through analysis and dashboarding, but also be jack-of-all-trade when it comes to provide data solution, improve internal process,assess 3rd-party data services and mentor junior team members.  Tilting Point offers a wide variety of benefits and perks including medical/dental/vision coverage, 401k with employer match, wellness stipends, unlimited PTO, inclusive and fully paid parental leave and much more!  Your Future at Tilting Point   Draw meaningful conclusions and provide actionable insights from data to shape and influence in-game features, economies, and future product roadmaps; Offer guidance and recommendations on in-game event tracking design and A/B testing.  Identify areas of opportunity for optimizing ad monetization yield and user acquisition ROAS performance, leveraging MMP data; Help maintain LTV forecast models.  Design data workflows that help build informative and easy-to-use dashboards, powered by scalable and efficient backend logic; Provide other data exploration solutions as needed.  Present analytical findings as both written communication and visual representations that are clear, concise and understandable, to both technical and non-technical audiences.  Build relationships with stakeholders and processes around data deliverables to ensure data driven decisions can be made at all levels across Tilting Point.  Collaborate with partner teams to define areas of opportunity and set priorities; Work with management to plan the roadmap and drive initiatives.  Design and evaluate data process, practice and solution to advance Tilting Point's analytics capability.   Your XP & Skills   University degree (BA or BS) in Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Management, Information Systems, Computer Science or a related field. Advanced degree strongly preferred.  5+ years of work experience as a data analyst or scientist, supporting consumer-facing products and digital marketing; mobile app/game preferred.  Highly proficient with SQL. Familiarity with Python, PySpark and/or Amplitude is a plus.  Expert in building interactive data toolings/dashboards. Experienced with Tableau and/or Looker.  Passionate about mobile/social gaming with a good understanding of the market.  Comfortable working with local and remote teams with different time zones and cultures.

Company Description Spark Foundry is a global media agency that exists to bring HEAT – Higher Engagement, Affinity, and Transactions – to brands. By combining flawless media fundamentals with aggressive innovation, Spark inspires consumers to pay more attention; to care more about our clients’ brands; and to buy more products and services from them. Balancing the nimble spirit of a startup with the powerhouse soul of Publicis Media, Spark Foundry delivers the best of both worlds to a client roster that spans some of the world’s best and most beloved brands and companies. We combine boutique-caliber insights and service with the buying clout and first-look access of a global leader, bringing the heat to challenger brands that want to act like giants, and to giant brands that want to act like challengers. With a bottom-up culture that celebrates diversity and aims for all voices to be heard, Spark has become a magnet for the industry’s best talent, with one of the best retention rates in the industry. And by applying a whole-person approach to professional and personal development, Spark develops a workforce that is well prepared for today’s challenges, and also poised to create meaningful careers in the years to come. Because we know that heat arises the intersection of complementary forces, our professionals come from myriad disciplines and backgrounds: data, analytics, and insights; content and creative production; communications and strategy; finance and marketing; and sociology, psychology, and other liberal arts disciplines.   Job Description We are looking for a data scientist who will help support our marketing initiatives. The ideal candidate is adept at utilizing large data sets to find valuable insights that drive the business forward. The ability to translate data into actionable recommendations and effectively communicate is vital. This role will provide managerial exposure as well as hands-on data science applications. Responsibilities: Develop and implement models to derive audience segments Prioritize attributes to append to each segment for statistical analysis Determine size, scale and opportunity of priority audiences Translate complex statistical concepts into simple language for non-technical stakeholders Ensure valid statistical testing and results Communicate data in a concise way keeping a keen eye on business implications   Qualifications   Either education or work experience in Data Science  2+ yrs of experience in Advertising or Marketing industry  Experience using statistical computer language (R, Python) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets  Experience using web services (Redshift, S3, etc.)  Experience working with and manipulating databases (SQL)  Working knowledge of advanced statistical concepts and machine learning techniques (regression, clustering, etc.)  Ability to work independently and communicate effectively  Knowledge of the evolving AdTech and MarTech ecosystems Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. 21-5935

Relocation Assistance Offered Within Country # 110199 - New York, New York, United States * About Colgate-Palmolive* Do you want to come to work with a smile and leave with one as well? In between those smiles, your day is comprised of connecting with others across the world, full of stimulating discussions, and making impactful contributions. If this is how you see your career, Colgate is the place to be! Our trustworthy household brands, dedicated employees, and sustainability commitments make us a company passionate about building a future to smile about for our employees, consumers, and surrounding communities. As the brand with the highest household presence in the world, we go beyond physical boundaries. We win as a global organization by continually learning and collaborating. The pride in our brand fuels a workplace that encourages creative thinking, fosters experimentation, and promotes authenticity which has contributed to our enduring success. If you are passionate about working for a company that lives by their values, then give your career a reason to smile...every single day. * The Experience* The Corporate Audit team at Colgate-Palmolive is looking for a multi-skilled Data Scientist to lead and build out our technological stack across risk, assurance & internal controls, and leverage analytics techniques to identify insights from our data to drive audit strategy and tactics. The successful candidate will apply data analytics techniques from both traditional statistics and machine learning to a combination of third party, publicly available and Colgate-Palmolive proprietary datasets, with the goal of answering business and risk questions. * Core Responsibilities* In collaboration with the Director of Audit, develop data-driven approaches and infrastructure to advise and accelerate strategies and tactics in support of the audit charter, by building robust Artificial Intelligence (ML, NLP, NLG, and DL) capabilities which can be scalable across multiple business use cases. Along with the Director of Audit, establish, run, and communicate data analytics guidelines and standards as well as establish, supervise, and improve analytics critical metrics for the department. Collaborate with partners to craft and deploy Machine Learning services that can be integrated with strategic systems. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Research and develop statistical learning models using complex mathematical concepts including multivariate analysis, Bayesian methods, decision trees and random forest, gradient boosting, linear regression, logistic regression, and optimization. Implement new statistical or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis. Work with cross functional teams to capture, wrangle, cleanse, structure, build models and coordinate with them implement models and monitor outcomes. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Provide expertise in area and advanced knowledge of applications programming and ensure application design adheres to the overall architecture blueprint. Strong experience in developing, validating testing and delivering high quality algorithms, with complete documentation of the approach, techniques used and traceability Develop extensive knowledge of how areas of business, such as architecture and infrastructure, integrate to accomplish business goals. Think strategically to use reusable components within the department and state of the art available externally when building the capabilities. Resolve a variety of high impact problems/projects through in-depth evaluation of sophisticated business processes, system processes, and industry standards. Translate functional requirements or specifications into technical solutions, and implement the solutions with plans and execution. Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in sophisticated data sets using various regression, classification or clustering ML approaches Build visualizations to represent data for consumption by different audiences; Communicate results with the appropriate level of detail, context and clarity needed. Mentoring and coaching more junior members of the team. * What you’ll need...* Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field. Master's preferred. 7-10 years of relevant experience working in a quantitative business environment Proficiency in statistical programming environments (such as R, Python or similar.) Familiarity with Dataiku is a plus Experience with data visualization tools (such as plotly, ggplot2, Google Data Studio, Sigma computing, Tableau, or similar.) Proficiency of statistical concepts (probability, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, etc.) Ability to travel per audits’ demand (up to 50%) * Preferred Qualifications* Consumer Goods Industry experience & managerial experience preferred You can apply to work at Colgate with us using this online application. Attach all relevant documents such as a cover letter and resume or CV. Applications received by email are not considered in the selection process. Become part of our team. We look forward to your application! Equal Opportunity Employer Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law. Are you interested in working for Colgate-Palmolive? You can apply online and attach all relevant documents such as a cover letter and resume or CV. Applications received by e-mail are not considered in the selection process. Become part of our team. We look forward to your application. Colgate-Palmolive is a leading global consumer products company, tightly focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition. Colgate sells its products in over 200 countries and territories around the world under such internationally recognized brand names as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, Tom’s of Maine, Sorriso, Speed Stick, Lady Speed Stick, Softsoap, Irish Spring, Protex, Sanex, Elta MD, PCA Skin, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Science Diet and Hill’s Prescription Diet. Company Description Bold. Results.  Rauxa is the full-service agency that helps brands such as Verizon, Alaska Airlines, and Audi to grow and thrive through Personal Digital Transformation. Founded in 1999 with a uniquely independent spirit, Rauxa is powered by a team of over 300 creators, technologists, scientists and practitioners with locations in New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, Orange County, and Dallas. Rauxa is part of Publicis Media, one of four solution hubs within Publicis Groupe.   Job Description The Lead Data Scientist is responsible for overseeing the organization and collection of large datasets from all kinds of different sources, (web APIs, internal databases), performing exploratory data analyses, using statistical and econometric techniques on datasets, identifying the best techniques to identify causal impact and attribution, and developing, implementing, and deploying different modeling projects as required by the agency clients. What You'll Do: Guide and manage junior members of the team in performing extraction of data sets from multiple marketing/database platforms and perform hygiene and quality control steps. Provide thought leadership in new marketing analytics methodologies, techniques, tools & technologies Scope, price and staff analytical engagements Oversee analysts/senior analysts as they derive and write clearly articulated key findings and observations from analyzing various data sources Manage various external vendors including online services firms, content management, advanced modeling, research firms, or other services firms such as media, social, PR, direct mail, telemarketing, events marketing firms Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and the evolving analytics landscape Keep up-to-date with latest technology trends Communicate results and ideas to key decision makers Implement new statistical or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis Optimize joint development efforts through appropriate database use and project design Work with senior/junior team members to gather/clear data, prepare features for AI models, train/deploy models locally and the cloud, and build/deploy web apps locally and the cloud What You’ll Do: Consult on and/or lead projects that encompass direct interaction with internal business clients and peers at external clients Identify opportunities to use statistics and machine learning to create advanced analytics and value-added insights in a documented and repeatable process Identify new opportunities to leverage data assets Develop and deliver high-impact tools and insights comprised of aggregated data sets and advanced algorithms with a clean user experience Drive the collection and manipulation of new data and the refinement of existing data sources Have leeway to work in areas such as Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Regression and classification modeling Apply time series analysis expertise to relevant challenges   Qualifications Who You Are: You have a Bachelor’s degree (B.S.) or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Finance, Mathematics; Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math or related field preferred You have 5-7 years of work experience in marketing analytics or related field such as advertising, direct marketing, online marketing, loyalty marketing, using data to solve complex Marketing problems You have working knowledge of marketing/advertising/research principles You have 4+ years of practical experience in data processing, database programming and data analytics using programming languages such as R, Python, Java, SQL, etc. You have an extensive background in data mining and statistical analysis You are able to understand various data structures and implement common methods in data transformation You have an excellent pattern recognition and predictive modeling skills. You have experience with NLP libraries: Spacy/SparkNLP You have experience with Computer Vision You have experience with Deep Neural Networks & TensorFlow You are experienced with BigQuery, Google AppEngine, DataProc, Docker & Kubernetes You have experience training/deploying/maintaining AI models. Sound like you? We'd love to hear from you!  Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Who we are:  The Decision Sciences team is growing rapidly to support the agency’s clients in a wide range of areas where cutting-edge analytics and insights are a critical input. Through the innovative application of AI and ML algorithms, we enhance decision-making related to setting budgets, optimizing channel mixes, guiding creative selection, developing next best customer experiences, and measuring business results, to name just a few application areas. We develop repeatable best practices to manage data, build and run models and present results in a clear, concise manner. What we do is in service of clients and media planning teams who look to us for our insight, experience and the genuine desire to solve complex business problems in the sphere of media and marketing. If you enjoy a dynamic and fast-paced work environment and are passionate about applying data science and analytics to drive decision making, read on! What the role will accomplish:  As Director, Decision Sciences, you will lead and manage a range of modeling and analytical projects such as marketing mix modeling, segmentation, multi-touch attribution, match market ANCOVA, TV incrementality, among others. You will lead a team of data scientists to achieve results in a timely manner. You will liaison regularly with media planning teams, data science and media teams at client organizations, and work with global cross-functional teams at Havas. You will be responsible for setting project scopes as it pertains to team size and composition, timelines and CoE (Center of Excellence) resources. Beyond day-to-day project management, your thought leadership will make a huge difference to the role. Key responsibilities:  · Develop data science and analytics proposals and grow the portfolio of Decision Sciences projects with new and existing clients · Manage the development and regular use of econometric models, attribution techniques, incrementality analyses and custom analytics using ML/AI tools · Engage closely with client, partner and agency stakeholders to collect and aggregate data such as sales, media, distribution, pricing, promotions etc. · Unearth actionable insights from data, and provide forward-looking guidance that help media and client teams achieve their business objectives · Present results of analyses to senior clients and agency stakeholders · Collaborate closely with client teams and agency planning teams to ensure that analytics are integrated into their decisions · Support the agency's new business pitches · Coach, develop and mentor members of the Data, Analytics and Martech Team at Havas Required Skills:  · Experience developing models and advanced analytical tools such as multivariate regression, logistic regression, Bayesian techniques, ANOVA/ANCOVA to measure test & learn, forecasting, segmentation / cluster analysis etc. · Fluency in a statistical programming language such as R, SAS, SPSS, Python · Strong knowledge of statistics and the ability to explain concepts in layman terms to clients and agency stakeholders (e.g., correlation & regression, significance testing, t-stats, z-score, etc.) · Experience in BI tools (such as Tableau/Power BI) is preferred. · Being a data storyteller is a great asset. · Demonstrable knowledge of the media and marketing world including metrics such as GRPs, Impressions, ROI/Efficiency, Effectiveness, Customer LTV, Cost per’s etc. and concepts such as adstock, carryover, saturation curves etc. · Strong verbal and written communication skills · Ability to work in teams, including remotely with global teams Qualifications:  · Bachelor’s degree or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as economics, statistics, mathematics, engineering, or operations research. PhD is a big plus · 12+ years applying data science / econometric modeling and AI/ML to drive and influence business results · 7+ years working in the media or consulting industry · Experience presenting to senior clients at the VP+ level · 7+ years experience managing a team · Ability to juggle multiple clients and projects · Vendor management and experience working with offshore resources are a plus Job Type: Full-time Pay: $175,000.00 - $225,000.00 per year Schedule: 8 hour shift Education: Master's (Preferred) Experience: Python: 1 year (Preferred) SQL: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location

OkCupid is looking to hire a Senior Machine Learning Engineer! If you're an ML Engineer that likes the idea of working on a product used by millions of people, read on. What's it like being a Machine Learning Engineer at OkCupid? We're a tight-knit team of Machine Learning Engineers that manage all aspects of OkCupid's production modeling. We give lots of ownership; your input will be a big part of what we do and how we do it. You will have the opportunity to drive machine learning applications at OkCupid and the infrastructure needed to do so. There's a sense of satisfaction that comes from helping millions of people find love. If that's the kind of thing that appeals to you, you're probably a good fit for OkCupid!  What you'll work on:  Own, develop, evaluate, and communicate modeling approaches to complicated and potentially unfamiliar product problems. Select and research the right tools for the job, and make them all work well together Troubleshoot & find sustainable solutions for data issues and anomalies Proactively identify opportunities where infrastructure is appropriate to build and work with the data engineering and backend teams to do so Work with product teams (e.g., recommendations, pricing, moderation) to understand and drive user impact  We're seeking someone who:  Has 2-3 years of experience building Machine Learning models and workflows (TensorFlow, etc. a plus) Knows how to get data from a relational database with SQL and is fluent in working with it in Python Understands the fundamental and unique challenges behind productionizing algorithms learned from data. Can learn and communicate how to fit their knowledge in machine learning to a complex and evolving product Has a Bachelor's degree or equivalent real-world experience, preferably in a related field (Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math) Is always willing to learn and apply new techniques where appropriate  Bonus Points if you have:  Experience with a mass-market consumer-facing product Familiarity with auto-differentiation libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.) Proficiency with the pydata stack (NumPy, scipy, pandas) Familiarity with scheduling and orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Metaflow, etc.) Experience with large scale distributed data processing (e.g., Spark, EMR) Familiarity with AWS services (e.g., SageMaker, S3, EC2, etc.) What’s in it for you? Competitive salary and full benefits, including Medical, Dental, Vision, and 401k Workstation and tools of your choice Paid attendance to conferences Complimentary catered lunch and an endless supply of snacks & drinks (in-office) Monthly snack boxes (remote) Company funded happy hours/events Discounted fitness membership with ClassPass Generous maternity and/or paternity leave and contributions towards fertility preservation A team full of incredibly curious and friendly people OkCupid is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.

MSc in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics or a related quantitative field  10+ years of practical experience applying DS to solve complex problems;  Experience with statistics packages such as R, SAS or Python;  SQL experience  Experience distilling informal customer requirements into problem definitions, dealing with ambiguity and competing objectives. Defining and identifying success  Superior verbal and written communication and presentation skills, ability to convey rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts.  Experience with end to end feature development (owning feature definition, roadmap development and experimentation  Amazon Worldwide Advertising is one of Amazon's fastest growing and most profitable businesses. The Advertising Console Product and Technology team is a group of creative individuals whose vision is to make the Amazon Advertising Console (AAC) the most loved and used tool for all advertisers to market and grow their businesses, brands, and products to a global customer base. The AAC is a collection of federated applications that combine to form the face and brand of Amazon Advertising. ACPT owns the delivery of the software, processes, and tools that allow teams across Amazon to build, support and enhance applications and features that deliver a cohesive advertising experience to all advertisers worldwide. By using our development kit and reusable components, developers can rapidly build features that integrate seamlessly within the suite of advertiser products. We use survey research, data science, machine learning, experimentation, and predictive modeling to understand advertiser dynamics, drive platform optimization, support evidence-based decision making, and help to develop predictive, intelligent features. As a Principal Data Scientist, you will be responsible for identifying, scoping, and delivering inference-driven features. You will anticipate data and science-related bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make trade-offs, and balance business needs versus scientific and technical constraints. An ability to take large, scientifically complex projects and break them down into manageable hypothesis and experiments to inform, functional specifications, then deliver features in a successful and timely manner is expected. Maturity, high judgment, negotiation skills, ability to influence are essential to success in this role.  As a Principal Data Scientist you will:   Partner with business, product, and engineering stakeholders in the development of inference-driven features.  Work closely with business, product, and engineering stakeholders to deliver inference-driven features.  Actively identify existing and new features which could benefit from predictive modeling and productionization of predictive models  Actively identify and resolve strategic issues that may impair the team’s ability to meet strategic, scientific, and technical goals  Partner with research stakeholders to create, maintain, and prioritize the hypothesis and experimentation backlog.   Why you will love this opportunity:  Amazon is investing heavily in building a world-class advertising business. This team defines and delivers a collection of advertising products that drive discovery and sales. Our solutions generate billions in revenue and drive long-term growth for Amazon’s Retail and Marketplace businesses. We deliver billions of ad impressions, millions of clicks daily, and break fresh ground to create world-class products. We are a highly motivated, collaborative, and fun-loving team with an entrepreneurial spirit - with a broad mandate to experiment and innovate.  Impact and Career Growth:  You will invent new experiences and influence customer-facing shopping experiences to help suppliers grow their retail business and the auction dynamics that leverage native advertising; this is your opportunity to work within the fastest-growing businesses across all of Amazon! Define a long-term science vision for our advertising business, driven from our customers' needs, translating that direction into specific plans for research and applied scientists, as well as engineering and product teams. This role combines science leadership, organizational ability, technical strength, product focus, and business understanding. Team video ~ https://youtu.be/zD_6Lzw8raE   Experience with problem framing across multiple sub-domains, including forecasting, anomaly detection, classification, and regression.  Expert level knowledge in statistics.  Understanding of various data applications used across large scale distributed systems ( EMR, Spark, Elasticsearch, Hadoop, Pig, and Hive).  Experience leveraging existing ML methods and techniques at scale in production oriented environments.  Combination of technical and business acumen, with ability to advocate technical solutions for science with engineering and business audiences.  Ability to develop experimental and analytical plans for data modeling, use effective baselines, and accurately determine cause-and-effect relations.  Experience in computational advertising.
